meanings.definition: The short, erect tail of a hare, rabbit, or deer.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit's scut twitched nervously as it hopped away.
meanings.sent2: I saw a deer with a fluffy scut bounding through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to tie a bow with the rabbit's scut.
meanings.sent4: Her scut of hair stood straight up in the morning breeze.
meanings.sent5: The scut of the hare was a white puff against the green grass.

meanings.sent1: He was often overlooked, seen as just a scut in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a scut next to the popular kids at school.
meanings.sent3: The scut of a student surprised everyone by winning the science fair.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the scut of a character turned out to be the hero.
meanings.sent5: Despite his scut appearance, he had a heart of gold.

meanings.sent1: The scut of a man stood out in the crowd of tall athletes.
meanings.sent2: She admired the confidence of the scut who led the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The scut of a chef amazed everyone with his culinary skills.
meanings.sent4: The scut of a wrestler was deceivingly strong on the mat.
meanings.sent5: The scut of a bodyguard made him seem even more intimidating.
